articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Brexit: What just happened?
articles.description: The EU has agreed to delay Brexit but with conditions. What does it mean? And what may happen next?
articles.content:
Media caption"I hope we can all agree we are now at the moment of decision"
The EU has agreed to postpone Brexit from next Friday and give UK Prime Minister Theresa May more time to get her deal approved in Parliament.
But - and with Brexit there is always … [+4063 chars]

articles.title: Syria condemns Trump's Golan remarks
articles.description: Syria criticises the US president for saying it is time to recognise the occupied Golan as Israeli.

articles.title: Two US soldiers killed in Afghanistan
articles.description: The deaths double the number of US service members killed in Afghanistan this year.
articles.content:
Image copyrightAFPImage caption
 The US has about 14,000 troops in Afghanistan and is part of a Nato mission there
Two US service members have been killed while serving in Afghanistan, Nato says.

articles.title: N Korea quits liaison office with S Korea
articles.description: North Korea withdraws from an inter-Korean liaison office opened to encourage talks with the South.
articles.content:
Image copyrightReutersImage caption
 The office was opened with great fanfare on Friday
North Korea has withdrawn from the inter-Korean liaison office opened last year to encourage talks with the South.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Christchurch women show headscarf 'solidarity'
articles.description: One week after the fatal shootings in two mosques, women in Christchurch demonstrate their support for Muslim women.
articles.content: VideoOne week after the fatal shootings in two mosques, women in Christchurch have been demonstrating their support for Muslim women.

articles.title: MPs have 'clear choice' as Brexit delayed
articles.description: Theresa May will once more urge MPs to back her deal after the EU says the UK's departure can be postponed.
articles.content:
Media caption"I hope we can all agree we are now at the moment of decision"
Theresa May will return to the UK later to try and convince MPs to support her withdrawal deal after the EU agreed to postpone Brexit beyond 29 March.

articles.title: The lives lost and the world they revealed
articles.description: From optimistic refugees to a couple deeply in love, Christchurch was meant to be safe for a new start.

The life stories of the Christchurch mosque victims are a striking reflection of a world in turmoil - one marked by war, poverty and economic inequality.
